Dialogue Boxes - Array Message

Please note that it is up to you to determine if your text fits within the one box. If your message takes more room it will run out the bottom of the box. You have the ability to split this longer message into multiple messages in an arrays.

An array is a simple list. An array allows one variable name to hold multiple instances of the same data type. We identify an array entry from the list with square brackets and the list number inside for example sample_array[3] would be the fourth item in an array called sample_array. Why fourth? We always start the array with 0 so the first time in the array would be sample_array[0]

Lets add an array to the npc's create event of various messages that would take more than one message box to display all of them. They are also separate thoughts.

obj_npc_tiger: Create Event

Open the npc collision event and alter which message to pass. We want to pass the entire array so we use the array name without the brackets so it sends the entire list to the function.

obj_npc_tiger: Collision | obj_player Event

Run the game by pressing the Play Button. Now you will see that it displays all the messages in order before the message disappears. Notice that the icon is an arrow when there is a message that is coming up.

rm_castle

Open the npc collision event and randomize the order the messages play so that each time the order will be different.

obj_npc_tiger: Collision | obj_player Event

Run the game by pressing the Play Button. Now you will see that it displays all the messages in random order before the message disappears. The order will be different each time! On the next page we will string messages together one after another.

rm_castle
